steps.description: Collect structural repair materials including metal patches, welding tools, and adhesives.
Assemble safety gear for climbing and securing both crew members.
Assess tower for visible structural damage.
Assist in removing debris and damaged components.
Apply metal patches over holes or tears using welding tools.
Provide support in applying patches or adhesives.
Secure larger structural issues with adhesives and temporary supports.
Ensure safety protocols are followed during high or difficult access points.
Assemble diagnostic kit, spare batteries, solar cells, and electrical repair tools.
Carry additional spare parts and protective equipment.
Perform diagnostics to identify power supply issues.
Assist in identifying damaged components.
Replace faulty batteries or solar cells.
Help in repairing or replacing wiring, ensuring secure connections.
Verify power system functionality post-repair.
Prepare alignment tools and calibration software on a portable device.
Assemble securing gear and safety equipment for both crew members.
Adjust the antenna to correct orientation using tools.
Assist in antenna inspection for misalignment or damage.
Secure antenna position; perform calibration test.
Support in adjustment and calibration process; maintain communication with mission control.
Collect replacement transceiver module and non-conductive tools.
Prepare electrostatic discharge safety equipment.
Remove the faulty module.
Assist in isolating power supply.
Install the new module ensuring all connections are secure.
Ensure module installation is correctly performed; conduct systems check to verify functionality.
Select Gear icon
Select Shutdown
Verify shutdown complete and notify EV2 and LMCC1
Move POWER – OFF, notify EV1 and LMCC1
Navigate to Comm Tower to retrieve one end of power cable
Retrieve spare cable
Take appropriate end of cable to MMRTG, notify EV1 and LMCC1 when at MMRTG
Disconnect damaged cable from Comm Tower, notify EV2 and LMCC1
Disconnect damaged cable from MMRTG, notify EV1 and LMCC1
Connect new cable from Comm Tower, notify EV2 and LMCC1
Connect new cable from MMRTG, notify EV1 and LMCC1
Move POWER – ON, notify EV1 and LMCC1
POWER – ON, notify EV2 and LMCC1
When start up complete, notify EV2 and LMCC1
Verify channel “B” is operational, notify EV2 and LMCC1
On LMCC1 Go, switch to COM – B
Perform comm check
If Comm good, EV1/LMCC1 switch back to COM-A, EV2/LMCC2 continue COM-B, else all to COM – A
